name: AccuStation
description:
THIS IS MULTIPLAYER (4-8) ONLY WHERE YOU USE ONE PHONE/COMPUTER AND TALK.

Gather a group of friends (4-8) in a line or semicircle, randomly and secretly distribute uniquely numbered cards (playing cards, sheets of paper, etc) to each person (which only they can see), and then allow a phone (or computer) to give the group hints as to the secret identities of the people around you!

WARNING: Requires Actual Human Thinking 2.0 or higher.

Tap the phone screen to reveal the next hint, and whoever picks up the phone has to be currently accusing another person of being a numeric identity. If they are correct, the accused turns over their card and is out of the game. If they are incorrect, the accuser turns over their card and is out of the game. You can make as many accusations as you would like while holding the phone, but you have to keep talking or set the phone down.

(Tap and hold for 2 seconds to enter new identities without re-entering everybody's name.)

I highly recommend you play this with a phone at a table with people, but you can also use a computer or use the in-browser version and tell everybody to close their eyes when you enter the secret identities.
